intro: Astragalus akkensis, commonly known as the Akkadian milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to parts of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus akkensis is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
